intro: Taeniopsis tricuspidata, commonly known as the three-lobed taeniopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three distinct lobes and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
